content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. Let <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function that is defined on the closed interval <math alttext="negative 5 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="g of 0 equals 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graph of <math alttext="g prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, consists of a semicircle and three line segments, as shown above. (a) On what intervals, if any, is <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> decreasing? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. Let <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function that is defined on the closed interval <math alttext="negative 5 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="g of 0 equals 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graph of <math alttext="g prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, consists of a semicircle and three line segments, as shown above. (a) On what intervals, if any, is <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> decreasing? Give a reason for your answer.

(b) Find the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 3 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Is there a value <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="negative 3 less than c, less than 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, for which <math alttext="g prime of c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 3 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(c) Find the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate of each point of inflection of the graph of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 5 comma 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>. Justify your answer.

(d) Let <math alttext="H of x equals, e raised to the 3 x power, times g of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="H prime of 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
